meanings.definition: In a manner contrary to law.
meanings.sent1: He drove unlawfully fast on the road.
meanings.sent2: She parked unlawfully in the no-parking zone.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel unlawfully stole nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled unlawfully through the night.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled unlawfully during the serious meeting.

meanings.sent1: The unlawful entry into the building alarmed the residents.
meanings.sent2: She was caught with unlawful possession of the stolen goods.
meanings.sent3: The cat's unlawful nap on the dining table amused the family.
meanings.sent4: His unlawful behavior painted him as a rebel in the community.
meanings.sent5: The storm caused unlawful damage to the fragile structure.
